page.title: 16The High Green,Great Ayton.
page.content: The High Green is one of the main features of Great Ayton.In the centre of the High Green there is a large lime tree over 80 years old.It was put there for{Queen Victoria's diamond {jubilee}and in 1912 a new coronation seat was put round the tree. On the edge of the Green is the{Friends {School}and before that was built the High Green was used for grazing animals.There are 21 trees on the Green.They include 9 almond trees planted by a former Headmistress of the Friends School.Around the Green there are many cottages with names such as 'Nut Shell''Orchard House' 'Hope Cottage'and 'Dixon House'.On June 20th,1985 we visited the High Green ,most people there,16 in all, were picnicing or taking in the sun. The High Green is a popular public place.
